text: :thinking_face: how's it hold up when it comes to cross-client compatibility?
that’s it’s entire goal. it holds up very well. to the point that it actually prevents you from doing things that will not be well supported. MJML’s devs are pretty active in their github too
Interesting, thanks Jon. Hadn't heard about them but we'll take a look :+1:

It seems to look pretty awesome and work really well. Only issue I have right now is there is a small bit of padding showing around the body of the email when in outlook but other than that, its been fast easy and awesome
They also have very awesome support in their slack, reached out to them yesterday morning and go a reply within an hour from the one of the founders of it. He's looking at my issue now
hmm where was their slack, I honestly tried to find that but couldn’t.
DM me your email, ill send you an invite

I should say the 1 negative thing about MJML is that it’s a little opinionated, but that’s also a plus. For example instead of using the Margin margin trick, they only allow using padding, but the way they’re doing padding works around Outlooks quirks so it’s fine.
btw if you’re not already in it <https://email.geeks.chat/>
oh i am, i believe you invited me to that one awhile ago lol
it’s one of the most useful resources for email dev (slack channel with top peeps)

<@U24DCSJBE> you’re probably already in there but <https://email.geeks.chat/>

Highly recommend it. There’s even a vendor-HubSpot channel already in there. granted that channel isn’t super active though
I am indeed in there :slightly_smiling_face: Thanks for sharing! The HS vendor channel is pretty quiet alright :sweat_smile:
part of that is the fact like this slack they’re not paying for it so messages older than like a week and a half vanish
